Posts.Content: Hello,   Has any females had an aspiration done on the breast?  A cyst showed up on my mammogram and I was told I have to have an aspiration.  I am a big wimp and would just love to hear from someone who has been through this.   Thanks,   Barbara
Posts.Title: Information on Aspiration

Posts.Content: Thanks for getting back to me, I hoped they numbed it first?  I am sorry to hear your husband has to go through what he has to.... My thoughts and prayers are with you,  Barbara C.
Posts.Title: Information on Aspiration

Posts.Content: Hello,   Was wondering if anyone (females only) ever had a lump in their armpit.  I just discovered one on my left side -- I just had a mammogram and ended up having a biopsy on the right three months ago and everything turned out fine, now this?  Was wondering if anyone would have any advice. Thanks,   Barbara
Posts.Title: Lump on armpit

Posts.Content: Hello, I was wondering if anyone can help me -- I am a 48 year-old female who gets mammograms every year since I was 35.  When I had one in May, they called me back and said they needed me to come in again because they needed better pictures and an ultrasound on both breasts.  So, I went and they told me there was a spot on the right breast that wasn't on last years mammo and that I would need a biopsy.  (They told me the same thing six years ago and I went to a breast surgeon for a second opinion and she said it was just nodules, that I didn't need a biopsy)  So I went to the same breast surgeon and she said it looks like just a cyst, but I have to have an aspiration done just to rule it out.  Can anyone give me any advice about any of this -- I need to call for an appointment for an aspiration; What is an aspiration like, as I am very anxious about the procedure?  Thanks,   Anxiously waiting
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Information

Posts.Content: Hello,  Thanks so much for getting back to me.  What is the difference between the two biopsies you had?  I never heard of those and was just curious.    My prayers and thoughts are with you,   Barbara Cathcart
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Information
